term.title: supporting electrolyte

item.text: An electrolyte solution, whose constituents are not electroactive in the range of applied potentials being studied, and whose ionic strength (and, therefore, contribution to the conductivity) is usually much larger than the concentration of an electroactive substance to be dissolved in it.

sources.item: PAC, 1985, 57, 1491. 'Recommended terms, symbols, and definitions for electroanalytical chemistry (Recommendations 1985)' on page 1501 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac198557101491)

term.citation: Citation: 'supporting electrolyte' in IUPAC Compendium of Chemical Terminology, 5th ed. International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry; 2025. Online version 5.0.0, 2025. 10.1351/goldbook.S06149

Users of these terms are encouraged to include the version of a term with its use and to check regularly for updates to term definitions that you are using.
